revised_title: On the Plasticity and Viscosity of Ice at or near Its Melting-Point
tldr: The author discusses recent theories and experiments on ice at or near its melting point, focusing on the plasticity and viscosity of ice. He presents his own theory, which suggests that the plasticity arises from a cycle of pressure, liquefaction, dispersion, and re-congelation, and argues against alternative theories proposed by Faraday, Tyndall, and Forbes.
